== Who I am ==

I am Joseph Salisbury a member of the Ubuntu Kernel Team, employed by Canonical. I help to maintain the Ubuntu kernels and related packages for all actively supported Ubuntu releases. I focus specifically on maintenance of the Real-time kernel, but I also help crank stable kernels every SRU cycle. 

== My Ubuntu story ==

I first started working with Sun Solaris and Linux in the late 1990s.  I started out at Canonical as a Server Support Engineer in 2010.  In 2011, I moved to the kernel team to work as a defect analyst, triaging and fixing kernel bugs.  From 2019 to 2021 I was at Microsoft as a Kernel Engineer supporting all major Linux distros on Azure.  In 2021, I returned to Canoncial and the kernel team to help with the real-time kernel.  Since 2009, Ubuntu was always my primary desktop, even at Microsoft.

=== My involvement ===
I've worked on thousands of Ubuntu bugs since 2010: https://bugs.launchpad.net/~jsalisbury.  I've submitted many kernel patches upstream as well as in the Ubuntu kernel.  I've fixed CVEs, reviewed patches on the mailing list, as well as other general kernel engineer tasks.  I enjoy helping all users with the challenge of getting Ubuntu to run functionally and performant on any hardware or in any cloud.

=== Upload Rights ===
I'm requesting upload rights for the kernel package set for all active series, which includes all the "linux*" packages.

=== Things I could do better ===
There are times I should slow down and focus on a particular issue and not multi-task so much.
